content.description:
Nazi Poster, 1933

bpk Bildagentur / Art Resource, NY

Translation of text: “Then, as now, we remain comrades. German Labor Front.” The German Labor Front was a Nazi-controlled labor organization that replaced the various independent German labor unions in 1933.
content.question: The poster’s portrayal of the two men as former First World War comrades is best explained by the Nazi Party’s desire to

choices.label: exploit feelings of bitterness felt by many Germans about the outcome of the war
incite class resentment between workers and professionals
remind workers of the human and material cost of the war
encourage more workers to get technical training

content.answer: exploit feelings of bitterness felt by many Germans about the outcome of the war
